title: 105_s2545
content:
The "Medicare HMO Protection Act of 1998" allows for the evaluation and alteration of termination decisions. The Social Security Act allows the Secretary to delay the termination of a Medicare+Choice plan if it poses a serious health risk to enrollees or reduces plan availability in the area. The Secretary may delay terminating Medicare+Choice plans in certain areas to prevent financial losses, audit records if needed, and end delays if an adequate provider network is established. The Secretary may delay termination of Medicare+Choice plans to maintain insurance coverage levels in affected areas. If termination is delayed, negotiations for a new contract can take place to ensure beneficiaries are not negatively impacted. SEC. 3. Extension of initial Medicare+Choice contract period to 3 years. Amends Section 1857(c)(1) of the Social Security Act to require contracts to have a term of at least 3 years. Effective for contracts entered into after the enactment of this Act.

SEC. 4. Notice of termination. Section 1857(d)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to require Medicare organizations to provide written notice 120 days before terminating a contract, including information on alternative plans and policies available in the area. The amendment requires Medicare organizations to provide notice of termination with information on local social service agencies assisting beneficiaries. Effective upon enactment of the Act.
